attributes.action: Cancel High Speed Two (HS2) and spend the money on our NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The latest report from the Care Quality Commission states that two thirds of A&E departments are overcrowded. 

Several A&E departments have been closed recently, including the Children’s A&E at Ealing hospital and there are 240,000 people in Chorley that do not have an A&E department.

The UK has fewer beds in A&E per 1000 of population than any other equivalent EU Country and we do not have enough junior doctors.

http://www.cqc.org.uk/sites/default/files/20161013b_stateofcare1516_web.pdf
attributes.background:
The cost to build HS2 is currently estimated at £55.7 billion with many experts predicting the cost to be closer to £100 billion by the time the scheme is completed around 2033.

Our Accident and Emergency departments are woefully short of funding and personnel.
